stimulusHtml: Each image shows a different way that products of the Industrial Revolution were transported. Which of the following statements best compares the impacts of the two forms of transportation?

features.html: Examine the images shown, then answer the questions that follow.

choicesHtml: The form of transportation in image A allowed for more global transportation of goods, while the form of transportation in image B allowed for more local transportation of goods.
Both forms of transportation required use of sustainable energy resources.
Both forms of transportation accelerated production and distribution of goods.
The form of transportation in image A generally transported goods, while the form of transportation in image B generally transported people.
Both forms of transportation discouraged the growth of cities.
